items.title: Tarsons Products| New capacities to potentially double revenue potential| Stock of the Day
items.description:
Tarsons Products Limited is an interesting proxy to healthcare where in it manufactures plastic labware for lab research, diagnostic centres etc.
Plastic labware is like ‘pick & shovel’ for the lab research segments like CRAMS, diagnostics, government research. Idea is to gain indirect exposure to the pharma research industry by investing in suppliers.
Company is undergoing a significant capex cycle which not only increases its revenue potential but also help company foray into high margin lab product lines. As the new plant is expected to operationalize in Q4 FY25, company can witness pickup of growth in FY26.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty suggests a flat start; US, Asian markets gain
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: A US tech stock rally and expectations of lower interest rates boosted global shares while the euro and dollar were steady on Wednesday despite political turmoil in South Korea and France. The S&P 500 added 0.6% to 6,086 and the Nasdaq Composite jumped 1.3% to 19,735 -- both record highs -- while the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.7%, to 45,014.

items.title: Agri Picks Report December 05, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Farmers in Gujarat have sown rabi crops over 2.1 million hectares as of Monday, down 28.4% on year from nearly 3 million hectares sown in the same period last year, according to a release by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Indus Towers block deal: UK's Vodafone Plc exits after Rs 2,802 crore stake sale
items.description: Vodafone PLC had announced plans to completely exit Indus Towers by offloading its remaining 3 percent stake in the company.

items.title: PG Electroplast stock climbs to record high after Rs 1,500 crore QIP launch
items.description: PG Electroplast's QIP will result in an equity dilution of 6.7 percent, with proceeds earmarked for working capital needs, loan repayment, and other general corporate purposes.

items.title: HEG shares jump 6% after Rs 172 crore block deal; extend gains to third session
items.description: HEG share price also skyrocketed 16 percent in the previous session, fueled by reports that China has tightened its review of graphite exports to the US, sparking concerns of a supply shortage.

items.title: IT index rises over 1% on positive comments from Powell
items.description: Speaking at a New York Times event, Powell, said that the US economy is stronger now than the central bank had expected in September when it began reducing interest rates, and appeared to signal his support for a slower pace of interest-rate cuts ahead.

items.title: EIH Limited: Why should you check into this hotel stock?
items.description: EIH Limited has outlined healthy room addition pipeline and has retained its long-term guidance of more than doubling its room inventory by 2030.

items.title: Bondada Engineering soars 3% after firm bags Rs 1,089 crore order
items.description: Bondada Engineering's latest order was awarded by the Bihar Renewable Energy Development Agency for the design, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of remote monitoring systems of smart solar street light systems.

items.title: Unicommerce shares rise 5% after partnering with sportswear brand Hummel
items.description: As part of the partnership, Hummel India has adopted Unicommerce's multi-channel order management and warehouse management systems, automating its order processing across both its brand website and various marketplaces.
